AspectDescription.value: A stringed instrument designed to be played by a duo, one using a bow and one plucking with spectral fingers. Mark to allow all present to see spirits and the spectral realm for the duration of a song.
You’re haunted by a benevolent spirit. Mark to learn a secret from the spectral realm (once per scene).
You can clearly see spirits and the spectral realm.
A sly ship-born feline, adept at pursuing tiny creatures. Mark to create a resource, Hunter’s Offering.
Burn to borrow a measure of an ancestor’s competency, gaining two ranks in any skill for the duration of a scene.
A compact crossbow. Deals LR spike damage.
You are immune to hallucinations, mesmerics and mental compulsions.
A trusty blade used as a tool as often as it is a weapon. Deals CQ hewing damage. Increase impact when clearing vegetation with this gear.
A vestige of the long-buried past. When you would mark mire you can choose to mark this instead.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Keen, Spike, Hewing, Serrated
A curved blade that deals CQ keen damage.
Crafted from reclaimed wreckage, said to hold the luck that others lack. Whenever you gain a temporary benefit, increase that benefit’s track by one box.
Thickly-woven fibres sealed with tar. Resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
Reduce the impact of poisons, diseases and sickness.
You’re a natural survivor. Rolls made to treat or heal an injury you're suffering from treat conflicts as triumphs.
A loyal lupine companion that will defend you to the death. Deals CQ spike damage.
Deal spike damage to any creature that attacks you with their own body in close quarters (such as with tail or bite attacks)
Flightless desert bees that crawl across your body. You are immune to damage and effects caused by swarms.
Use a task to give any liquid resource the ‘Pure’ tag.
A quilled, fibrous feline with a penchant for firing spines when provoked. Deals LR spike damage
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Spike, Hewing, Serrated, Frost, Flame.
An ancient seal of a trade and fealty. Burn to call attention to this trophy and request a favour from another non-hostile ektus - it should not be refused
A set of weighty throwing blades, dealing LR keen or hewing damage.
Heal a mark of damage on any one of your traits after spending a day in strong sunlight.
You can see heat the way others see colour.
Your body is covered in iron-hard spines that deal CQ spike damage.
Treat conflicts as triumphs when attempting to avoid being tripped, pushed or forcefully moved.
A tattered tome of ancient stories handed down by the eldest ektus survivors of the pre-verdant days. Use a task to gain a sliver of Pre-V information.
Resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
An immense shield of wood and iron, built to last.
You stand head and shoulders above most others
A long-handled axe that deals CQ hewing damage.
A set of hip-drums decorated with saprekk-influenced patterns. Zephyrskin drums heat the air around them when played
Increase impact when using hiding or moving stealthily in either a natural or urban environment (choose which environment when you take this trait).
A slow-flying beetle riddled with fungal growths. Mark to gain a burst of dense sensory information from its surroundings, revealing oddities and secrets.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Keen, Hewing, Toxin, Acid, Frost.
You have an additional tendril-like limb, allowing you to hold and manipulate more objects than usual.
A leather cord studded with teeth or salvaged metal. Deals CQ serrated damage
You can shed light at will.
Others rarely ask where the medicines are collected. Use a task to create a rare resource, Medicinal Herbs.

You can see perfectly within sporeclouds, and you resist 
the effects of bad air and airborne spores
Your sheddings have mild psychotropic properties. Mark to create a rare resource, Hallucinogenic Spores.
A blackened glass jar that holds an eager colony of ironroot mold. Use a task to create a specimen copy of any piece of salvage you own, with the ‘fungal’ tag.
A slow-moving but well-armoured fungal companion that wants nothing more than to keep you safe.
Burn to grant an ally a copy of any one of your aspects (other than this one) as a temporary benefit. The benefit’s track is equal to the original aspect’s track.
Mark to obscure your current area with a dense cloud of spores.
A sling-like contraption for lobbing spore-bombs, dealing LR toxin or blast damage
A loyal companion that deals CQ toxin damage.
A flexing mantle of myconic flesh that unfurls to increase your physical size. Treat conflicts as triumphs when intimidating smaller targets
You’re immune to the effects of crezzerin
Your animating spark can leave your body for a short time, becoming ghost-like and insubstantial but still capable of movement.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Keen, Serrated, Acid, Volt.
Use a task to create a resource, Keel-Fruit.
You count as fluent when communicating with ghosts, spirits and other ironbound, regardless of languages used
Your own wreck-salvaged body contains an array of useful tools - your presence gives an automatic advantage on rolls taken to create temporary gear and machinery to all crewmates.
Whenever you gain a chart, mark to gain a related whisper as well
A huge ships’s cannon loaded with explosive shells. Deals LR blast damage. Increase impact when targeting a horde or swarm of targets.
A ship’s prow, refashioned into a massive bludgeoning weapon. Deals CQ blunt damage.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Spike, Hewing, Serrated, Frost, Flame
A mass of living canvas capable of flight. Mark to have it tangle around a target, restricting their movement.
When your ship would take damage to any of its ratings you may mark boxes equal to that damage on this companion instead.
Flameless, but terribly bright nonetheless. Consume a resource as fuel to allow your entire crew to see perfectly in darkness, sporeclouds and general murk.
Once per journey you may repair a mark of damage on your ship without rolling
You’re an imposing presence, a weight on the world
You can dredge up the voices of sailors long-lost, changing your pitch, tone and accent on a whim. Burn to speak the truth of a lost sailor.
Attached to a harness or embedded in your gelatinous flesh. Ignore cut while climbing, as long as you're moving with care.
The glowing patches on your flesh crawl at your command, even onto others nearby. Mark this track to create a dim but lasting light on you or a nearby target
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Spike, Toxin, Frost, Volt.
A rusted chain from a long-dead machine, now wielded as a weapon dealing blunt damage at CQ or LR.
A simple punchcard-driven repair construct. Increase impact when repairing or tinkering with other machines.
You have an inherent weakness to salt damage, but can squeeze and compress your body enough to move through spaces much smaller than expected.
A slick, symbiotic slime-like creature bonded with your body.
You’re immune to the usual effects of crezzerin. Concentrated sources of crezzerin heal rather than harm you
You have a short supply of clean air you can tap into when you need to, and you also resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
The internal structures you’ve collected can store biovoltaic energy. Use a task to create a resource, Scrap Bone Battery

You can use salvage as a component when concocting a 
potion or chemical mixture, no matter its form
A rare mutation that hones your sight. You can see clearly without light
Treat conflicts as triumphs when navigating or moving through enclosed areas.
The tendrils of your mantle crackle with lightning as they strike, dealing CQ volt damage
While in a dimly lit or unlit area, mark to learn a secret from the darkness (once per scene).
Your wings are a riot of colour and style. Mark to increase impact when trying to impress or convince.
A fighting style that makes use of wing-edges and scything kicks. Deals CQ keen or spike damage.
Your form is slim, light, and deceptively difficult to land a solid hit on.

Your beard is a rich, intertwining mass of fur and braids, perfect for concealing small objects. Burn to gain a new piece of salvage or specimen from within it (that you might conceivably have stashed there)
Though most mothryn wings now serve as decoration, yours are uncommonly strong. You can glide with ease, or mark for a short burst of elegant flight
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Keen, Blast, Acid, Frost, Salt
You can treat a conflict as a triumph when rolling for an action without a skill adding to your dice pool (once per scene).
Chart-like decorations cover your wings and fur. Mark to use this aspect in place of a chart, but only when travelling through an area you've visited before.
Dense clusters of sensory fronds grow from your antennae, letting you see clearly without light and through clouds of dust or spores.
Mark to create a cloud of fine dust that refracts light and distorts perception - your own senses are unaffected.
A living golem of beautifully spun silks, usually in vaguely lupine shape
You’re weak to Flame, but resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
A domesticated felinesque insect that sheds medicinally potent scale-dust. Your entire crew has resistance against infections and diseases
Can be launched like shrapnel with a deft twist, dealing LR blunt damage
You never cut for difficulty when climbing.
A ritual weapon made from the chitin of lost colony members. Deals CQ keen or salt damage.
You have one or more additional arms, allowing you to hold and manipulate many objects at once
Mark to produce a resource, Silk-Like Web (either dry or sticky).
Your clothes are woven of fine silk that naturally dampens sound, making even your dramatic movements almost entirely silent.
A secure, wearable lockbox that can only be opened by a single specific spider within you.
You count as fluent when communicating with intelligent insects, hive-minds and other tzelicrae, regardless of languages used
You’ve incorporated an assortment of discarded armour pieces into your skin
An unsettled fragment of personality. Mark to request a dark and unbidden (but likely pertinent) thought from the Firefly
Burn to leave your skin for a short period. When outside your skin you are a mass of moving spiders, and can easily move through small spaces and climb any surface.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Keen, Spike, Serrated, Hewing, Toxin.
You have a set of fangs that can deal CQ toxin damage
A single spider you can send ahead as a scout, allowing you to see and hear at a distance
Choose either Ardent, Ektus or Gau. You can pass as a member of this species under casual inspection
You can feel even the smallest vibrations in the air and ground around you
A smaller piece hewed from a greater whole. Burn to immediately and completely heal any one of your injuries.
A stringed instrument meant to be played in tandem by the living and the dead, but you can play both parts. Empowers nearby spirits when played.
Your grip on the world is tentative, but that does come with certain benefits. You are weak to salt and volt damage, but immune to blunt, keen and spike.
Some anchored prefer to hide their face, letting the memories of their time among the living fade. Treat conflicts as triumphs when attempting to unnerve or unsettle.

When being healed or having your gear repaired, resources used are not consumed as normal - instead they degrade, giving them a negative tag (if they already have a negative tag, they’re consumed as normal).
Loyal to the grave, and beyond. Mark to ignore the effects of an active mire for the rest of the scene.
You can manipulate nearby objects without touching them, though the heavier they are the harder it is.
Though you can do so if you choose, you have no real need to eat, drink, sleep or breathe
The ghost of a sword hovering at your hip. Deals CQ salt damage, and doesn't have to be held to be used.
Spirits and the spectral realm become more visible and tangible to your entire crew in your presence.
Whenever your crew gains a piece of cargo, gain a whisper related to it (or its previous owners) for yourself.
Mark to become insubstantial for a short time, allowing you to float and pass through solid objects.
Your anchor to the world is reinforced against damage and tampering, a wise move for a fleeting ghost
Once per scene, when your crew gains a resource, you can choose to give it the Spectral tag.
Your skin (or whatever you have as an outer covering) mimics the mountain you were raised on. You're immune to keen damage, as well as bites and stings from small creatures
You may not be built fancy, but you are built sturdy

Treat conflicts as triumphs when altering or working 
with stone or bone.
Your fists and feet are the only weapons you need. They deal CQ blunt damage

Whenever you gain a stone-based resource, give it the 
Sacred tag.
These might have deep ceremonial meaning, or just cut an impressive silhouette - either way these horns deal CQ spike damage, and you ignore cut when defending yourself against charging opponents.
Mark to Levitate and control exposed bone
You never mark mire when confronted with an unknown or terrifying beast, no matter the size
An ill-tempered boar with cruel tusks. Deals CQ spike damage, and is large enough to ride.
You can clearly see spirits and the spectral realm
Mark to ask a question and receive an omen to interpret in return (Supplied by the Firefly)

Holds a sliver of power from a not-quite-god. Deals LR 
salt damage.
Once per scene, increase impact on any successful action taken whilst on ancient ground
A surly, vicious bird that can deal LR keen damage. Once per scene, hijack to temporarily blind or distract an attacking opponent.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Toxin, Cold, Salt, Volt.

Consume a whisper to learn a secret about a nearby 
individual (supplied by the Firefly).
You always know true North, and ignore cut on movement-related actions caused by adverse seas or damage to your ship.
When you make a discovery during a journey, mark to tie it to your family in some way (such as a blood relative, fleetfamily member or family friend)
Add a positive tag to any living specimen you acquire while fishing
A beautifully made sporescarf passed from traveller to seasoned traveller. You're immune to the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
Once per scene, increase impact on any successful action taken whilst aboard a ship you own or crew.
A rusting prosthetic that feels no pain.
You never mark mire for consuming food or drink, no matter the source or condition
Whenever you take a montage you can study your phrasebook (in addition to your usual task), gaining a smattering of any one language until your next montage.
Treat conflicts as triumphs when using social skills to affect animals.
A pugnacious lemur companion with a natural curiosity when it comes to the running of a wildsea vessel
Traditionally used for deckside defence. Deals CQ spike damage
A simple slingshot, loaded with anything from stones to scrap to seeds. Deals LR blunt or blast damage
A nimble wildsea vulpine known to dance in the wake of larger ships. Once per journey you may treat the outcome of a watch roll as Peace, no matter the result.
You can instantly identify the presence and potential dangers of nearby predatory plants, no matter how well they're camouflaged.
Resist the hazardous effects of crezzerin exposure (searing, hallucinations, mutation)
Mark to remember a rumour or folktale pertinent to your situation (supplied by the Firefly)
Both a weapon and an acrobatic aid. Deals CQ blunt damage.
Expert at routing hidden bugs, even from the mighty ironroots. Mark or use a task to gain an insect specimen from a nearby branch or tree trunk
Exquisitely crafted. Deals LR spike or toxin damage
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Serrated, Toxin, Frost, Salt.
A beautifully-feathered lizard, the result of generations of careful breeding to engender a modicum of sociability (still not quite there yet). Deals CQ hewing damage, and is large enough to ride.
Use a task to study a tree (of any size) and learn its secrets, age and condition (supplied by the Firefly)
You can land safely after any prepared fall.
When the hook is thrown and anchored it allows you to swing over chasms and climb sheer surfaces. Treat conflicts as triumphs when climbing or swinging.
You can see much further and in greater clarity than the typical wildsailor.
You’re immune to vertigo, nausea and mire caused by heights and precarious positions.
Once per scene, increase impact on any successful action taken whilst you have the high ground
A talon-like gauntlet inspired by the hunting patterns of wingless birds. Deals CQ hewing damage, and can be used to make controlled descents down vertical surfaces.
Mark to sprint up a surface that would usually require you to climb it, even if it’s unstable.
A watchful bird, often used for scouting remote areas. Mark to learn a secret of the surrounding waves.
An elegant defensive dance that keeps you out of harm’s way.
A spice-filled pipe made to burn its contents with acid rather than flame. Injury tracks you become subject to are one box shorter than normal.
A firearm sourced from unsavoury types. Deals LR blast damage.
A brute but reliable weapon for street fights. Deals CQ blunt damage.
A semi-spectral cat winds its way around your legs. You have the ability to see clearly without light
Once per scene, increase impact on any successful action taken whilst in a port or city
Resist the hazardous effects of crezzerin exposure (searing, hallucinations, mutation)
Mark to learn a secret of a port or city you’re docked at.
When gaining a benefit from a meal or alchemical concoction, ignore any associated negative effects.
Half pangolin, half squid. Surprisingly cute
You learnt how to take a beating and stay standing
You can tell a fake, forgery or counterfeit item at a glance.
Treat conflict as triumphs when haggling over an exchange of cargo or resources.
Use a task to remove a negative tag (such as rusted or broken) from any piece of salvage.
Treat conflicts as successes when moving through crowds, herds and swarms.
A gutter-scavenger by nature, now working on your behalf. Once per montage gain a small salvage or specimen resource with a negative tag (in addition to your usual task).
Mark to discover a friendly lead on services or information when in a port or city.
Consume an additional specimen to create a lasting concoction as an action (rather than the usual task).
Whenever you discover a new location, choose a unique property (represented by a tag) to be easily found on specimens or salvage there.
Mark to briefly ignore any positive or negative effects stemming from a temporary benefit or injury. You are always immune to the negative effects of crezzerin.
A heavy work-pack containing reagents and catalysts, tried and tested. Mark to use a chemical from the belt in place of a specimen when concocting.
Mark to levitate and control impure liquids
When one of your crewmates acquires an alchemically useful specimen, gain a copy of that specimen for yourself (once per scene)
When you create a lasting concoction the entire crew can gain the benefit it offers as a one-track temporary aspect.
Not an endless supply, but potent and disorienting. Mark to deal LR blast, salt, acid or toxin damage to multiple nearby foes
Mark to ruminate on a question and receive a confusing yet accurate answer. Burn instead to receive instant clarity from that answer
Winds its way around your form, studded with broken glass. Deals CQ acid or keen damage.
Consume a specimen to gain a brief burst of sensory information related to the specimen consumed (such as tremorsense by consuming a spider's web, for example).
Use a task to grind a specimen into a powder, changing its form to a dust or salt and giving it the ‘Pure’ tag.
Treat conflicts as triumphs when using at least one liquid as a resource for a concoction.
A diminutive alchemical construct designed to hold and drain fluids without being detected.
Increase impact when concocting using only bone, organs or insect parts as components

You can swallow two alchemical components, keeping them safely in your stomach. You can concoct them internally when you choose, benefitting immediately from the results or spitting the resulting solution out
A hefty pot of near-unbreakable construction, used to prepare and store food or hide under in a tense situation
Whenever you discover a new location, choose a single specimen type to be easily found there.
Increase impact when cooking with rotten or otherwise tainted ingredients. Meals made with these ingredients won’t sicken your crew
When you create a lasting meal the entire crew can gain the benefit it offers as a one-track temporary aspect.
You can treat salvage as specimens when creating meals. The results are still oddly edible
Mark to identify a rare ingredient in your vicinity by scent alone.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Toxin, Acid, Blast, Salt, Flame.
When one of your crewmates acquires a potentially delicious specimen, gain a copy of that specimen for yourself (once per scene)
Consume an additional specimen to create a lasting meal as an action (rather than the usual task)
Mark when gathering a specimen to give it the ‘Pure’ tag
A colossal implement. Deals CQ blunt damage.
As useful on the battlefield as it is in the galley. Deals CQ hewing damage. Increase impact when acquiring dangerous or disruptive specimens.

Sous Squirrel 2-Track Companion
A red-furred bundle of activity. Once per montage gain a common insect specimen appropriate to the region (in addition to your usual task).
A bandoleer containing your own secret blend of spices that never seems to run dry. Mark to create a rare resource, either Wilds Pepper, Hangman's Blend or Smouldergrit
You're immune to poisons, and can determine their presence and characteristics by taste alone.
The right seasoning can make anything taste good. Mark to treat conflict results as triumphs while cooking.
You’re immune to mire while in combat, or any mire that would be caused by witnessing violence
A savage weapon used to chop through foes. Deals CQ hewing damage. Increase impact when attacking ships, objects and structures
You can deal damage to multiple nearby opponents with a successful CQ attack.
A classic wildsea blade. Deals CQ keen damage
Mark to hijack focus from a trap or ambush as it triggers.
Treat conflicts as triumphs when attempting to trip, knock down, blind or stun opponents.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Keen, Spike, Hewing, Blast.
Shake gently to produce temporary torchlight, or mark to produce a blinding flash
A loyal bird trained to distract opponents in close-range combat. Mark to hijack focus from a nearby enemy as they attempt to attack, once per scene.
Treat conflicts as triumphs when attempting to prevent harm being done to a member of the undercrew.
Mark to increase impact when attacking at close quarters.
Mark to gain a whisper based on damage or an injury you’ve just taken, supplied by the Firefly.
A versatile weighted hammer with a fabric tether. Deals blunt damage at CQ or LR
The key to survival is solidity. You can take whatever they throw your way and stay standing.
The key to survival is mobility. They can’t hurt you if they can’t hit you
You can target attacks precisely (such as when aiming for a weak point) without cutting for difficulty
Perfectly weighted. Deals LR keen or spike damage.
Goggles that allow you to see perfectly through smoke, mists and sporeclouds.
A complex depth-gauge for measuring your precise distance from the Darkness-Under-Eaves. Increase your ship's Tilt rating by one when you're aboard.
Ignore cut that would be imposed for taking actions in enclosed or architecturally unstable spaces
Treat conflicts as triumphs when avoiding traps and environmental hazards
A curious little beast with a skeleton-key stinger. Once per scene you may open any mundane lock
You can use charts to find shipwrecks and disasters as well as the usual islands and oddities.
Add a positive tag of your choice to any salvage you acquire from wrecks, reefs and ruins.
Mark to discern the use or history of something ancient
Uses luminous moths to illuminate a small area around you.
Drawn to history and forgotten things. Consume a chart to identify and retrieve a piece of ancient and valuable salvage in your vicinity if possible
Whenever your crew gains a piece of cargo, gain a resource (likely salvage, but perhaps a specimen or whisper) related to that cargo for yourself.
Resist the hazardous effects of crezzerin exposure (searing, hallucinations, mutation).
A near-unbreakable coil of thick wire that is somehow soft to the touch. Can be re-coiled with a simple flick after being unwound.
Mark to make a prodigious leap and land safely without having to roll.
A punchcard intelligence in a noisy construct body, the whirring and clanking of this mouse-like companion is useful for drawing attention away from your position.
As much a tool as it is a weapon. Deals CQ blunt damage. Increase impact when smashing stonework and structures
Mark to create a small area of smoke that repels insects and lowers visibility.
Mark to become undetectable to plant-type hazards and creatures for the duration of a scene.
Explosive packets that burst when lobbed with force. Deals LR acid or salt damage.
Designed to find quick purchase in bark and boughs. treat conflicts as triumphs when traversing the sea.
A trained swarm of ragged insects. Burn to neutralize the effects of bad air and airborne spores for your crew for the rest of a scene.
You can tell which branches will break and which will hold at a glance. Increase your ship's Saws rating by one when you're aboard
The archetypal hacker weapon, a sawtooth sabre that deals CQ hewing or serrated damage.
Use a task to create a rare resource, Pure Spit or Pure Sweat.
You ignore mire caused by plant-based hazards and horrors, and are resistant to acids, toxins and hallucinatory effects caused by predatory plants.
Not the easiest creature to pet, but you learn to live with it. Ignore cut caused by pain or discomfort.
Becomes more flavourful the more it gets jostled and shaken. Whenever you gain a benefit from a concoction or meal, increase its track by two boxes
A set of sharpened circular blades made for throwing, dealing LR keen or serrated damage.
The wildsea teaches harsh, but useful, lessons.
Increase impact when finding routes and clearing paths through vegetation
Resist the hazardous effects of crezzerin exposure, insect bites and poisons
Treat conflicts as triumphs when attacking or defending against plant-type hazards
Intoxicating to certain species. Treat conflicts as triumphs when trying to distract, divert or drive off a wildsea creature
When you enter a new port, mark to find a friendly contact you’ve exchanged letters with in the past.
Whenever your crew gains a piece of cargo, gain a whisper related to that cargo for yourself.
Increase impact when communicating with an individual for the first time
Mark to learn a smattering of any language you hear and have no ranks in. This knowledge remains until you choose to mark and replace it with a new language.
Mark to identify a hidden or forgotten space in your vicinity by gut feeling alone.
Whenever you or your crew successfully defuse a situation that was heading toward a fight, clear a mark of mire.
Used to help train the wild creatures of the sea. You’re resistant to bite attacks, no matter the damage type.
Gain a whisper whenever you encounter a spectacle, horror or new port during a journey
When communicating with a friendly individual in their natural language treat conflict results as triumphs
An ektus delicacy that sharpens the palette. Whenever you or a crewmate gains a benefit from a meal or beverage, increase the track for that benefit by one box.
Anything from a guitar to maracas, a hip drum to an accordion, a sitar to an ocarina. Can be played, but also acts as a CQ blunt weapon in a pinch.
Once per scene increase impact when engaged in a performance of some kind.
Use a task to tag along with one of your crewmates, gaining a temporary rank in any skill they display. This rank lasts until you next use watch and learn.
Consume a whisper to learn a secret of the sea.
Your sense of smell is highly developed, allowing you to hunt and track by scent alone
Deal keen damage to any creature that attacks you with their own body in close quarters (such as with tail or bite attacks)
You can butcher dangerous specimens without risk or cutting for difficulty, and increase impact when gathering resources from a creature you’ve hunted.
Increase impact when attacking from a hidden position, or attacking an unaware target
Choose either wild or urban areas. You leave barely any trace, and are almost impossible to track, when moving through your chosen area.
A long-bladed spear with cruelly curving teeth. Deals CQ serrated damage.
A finely-crafted bow paired with an expansive quiver. Can deal LR damage of three types chosen from the following list: Spike, Toxin, Blast, Volt, Salt.
When you take this trait choose either beasts, plants or insects. You're resistant to all damage from your chosen source.
Collected from sleeping leviathans, apparently. Burn to drive a beast or insect of the waves into an intense instictual behaviour (such as fear, hunger or frenzy).
Your guidance allows your vessel to keep a lower profile, disturbing fewer creatures and leaving less of a tell-tale trail. Increase your ship's Stealth rating by one when you're aboard.
A fishing rod designed to be left unattended. Once per journey gain a live specimen appropriate to the area you're travelling through.
Count conflicts as triumphs when readying traps, snares or ambushes
Every moment of its life is a hunt. Mark to identify a weak point or weakness of a creature you can see
Use a task to create a resource, Paralyzing Venom.
Consume a whisper to gain cryptic information on a target’s whereabouts and actions.
Whenever your crew take a montage during a journey, choose one crewmember to perform an extra task of their choice (you can’t choose yourself)
When you uncover a new route or location you can mark this aspect. If you do so the Firefly will inform you of a second route or location at the same time.
A map-maker’s ordinator. Use a task to create a rare resource, Chart of the Rustling Waves
A small sidearm loaded with chemical flares. Deals LR acid damage. Can also be used to shed light over extremely large areas at will.
A simple musical instrument at first glance, playing the gale flute has the curious property of bringing favourable winds your way.
While aboard your ship you can see as though you had eyes at any point across the outer hull
You know the secret paths of the fireflies. Mark to discover a location without using a chart (once per scene).
Mark to learn the never-reached destination or port of origin for any wreck you come across. Burn to learn it for a ship still travelling.
A spyglass that allows you to see much further and in greater clarity than the average wildsailor. When you have a commanding view, mark to learn a secret of the surrounding waves.
When you discover a new route or location, uncover a secret about that area as well.
Once per journey allows a crewmember to roll 2d6 when on watch, then pick the preferred result. Also deals LR keen damage.
You have uncanny control over nearby ropes and rigging, which twist and move according to your will.
Mark to accurately predict the weather for the next few days
Resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
Mark to request an omen of the future (supplied by the Firefly).
A self-made automaton designed to offer fire support. Deals LR blast damage.
A nimble little scavenging construct. Once per scene, add a positive tag of your choice onto any piece of salvage you acquire.
When a crafted benefit's track is fully marked, gain a piece of salvage related to it before removing the benefit.
Tiny, incremental adjustments that you make without thinking keep your vessel's hull and superstructure in remarkable shape. Increase your ship's Armour rating by one when you're aboard.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Spike, Acid, Blast, Volt, Flame.

Consume a chart to quickly create a set of schematics for a machine or mechanism you can see (represented by new chart). All actions to create such a machine yourself gain increased impact while you have this new chart.
When you craft, the resulting creation’s track is three boxes longer than usual.
Choose wood, metal or bone. Increase impact when crafting or repairing with your chosen material.
You gain ferrosight, the ability to see electric and magnetic fields.
You can use a task to work on repairing up to three pieces of gear or mechanical companions at a time
Contains salvage useful for crafting. Mark to use the contents in place of a resource when crafting.
A self-made automaton, large enough to ride.
Count conflicts as triumphs when repairing gear and mechanical companions.
Once per scene, swiftly craft a one-track creation without needing to roll
An insulated grip around a crackling, rudimentary cattleprod. Deals CQ volt damage, and you're immune to volt damage yourself.
You never cut for difficulty when including specimens in your crafting, no matter how grisly or unpalatable the process is
Mark to produce a cloud of metal fragments, obscuring vision around you.
Ignore cut when attempting to damage, break or deconstruct a machine or mechanism made of metal.
Mark to control or reshape exposed metal.
Once per scene give any piece of salvage you acquire the Magnetic tag.
Choose a single type of metal (such as iron or copper). Increase impact when repairing, crafting or using arconautics with your metal of choice.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Blunt, Spike, Serrated, Toxin, Volt.
You can sense nearby metals, see magnetic fields and always know the direction of true north.
A large mass of metal shaped to make it easy to carry, often used to enable ferrokinesis in places otherwise empty of metal. Deals CQ blunt damage.
You can manipulate your own magnetic field, allowing you to fly for short periods when close to dense masses of metal (such as a ship’s hull or kinetic anchor).
Worn as a simple decoration, but holds incredible magnetic potential. Burn to briefly move a massive amount of metal, up to the size of a ship.
Deal spike damage to any creature that attacks you with their own body in close quarters (such as with tail or bite attacks).
A cloud of floating debris you can direct with a flick of the wrist. Deals LR spike or keen damage.
Treat conflicts as triumphs when dodging or blocking attacks from constructs or metal weapons.
Extend the track of any temporary LR weapon you craft for yourself by two boxes.
You can deal damage to multiple distant opponents with a successful LR attack.
A long-barrelled rifle with an amber-lensed scope. Deals LR blast damage. Increase impact when attacking from a hidden position.
A sawn-off shotgun that can be loaded with shrapnel or salt rounds. Deals LR blast or salt damage.
You can target attacks precisely (such as when aiming for a weak point) without cutting for difficulty.
Consume a specimen to add a thematically appropriate damage type to one of your existing LR weapons. This added damage type persists until you use essence grinder again.
Increase impact when attacking from an elevated position.
You’re hard to shake, no matter what comes your way.
A heavy revolver with a rotating cylinder. Deals LR blunt or blast damage.
Once per scene you may instantly hijack focus when targeted by a ranged attack
Mark to produce a cloud of smoke, obscuring vision in your area for others, but not for you.
Mark to increase impact when attacking at long range.
You can use LR weapons in close quarters combat and tight engagements without cutting for difficulty.
Burn to attack a target you can’t see or don’t have line of sight to.
When attacking at long range, mark to count a conflict result as a triumph.
Spirits can always see and hear you, just as you can see and hear them.
You may elect to suffer the negative effects of a concoction instead of the one imbibing it
A place setting made of woven complexities. Allies may mark an aspect to benefit from one of your concoctions (with reduced impact)
This heirloom, eternities old, is used to create beverages that warm more than your body. Triumphs on rolls to concoct grant a Whisper.
Your body doesn’t look it but you are far older than you seem. You have learned many tricks to keep it so
Whether leaves, grounds, draff or bones, all concoctions leave remnants. Consume a specimen to ask a question and read an omen in your remnants
Old flavours burst in novel ways. Consume a whisper when an ally imbibes one of your concoctions, and benefit from an aspect of theirs until the concoction has worn off.
Like a Salamax, just smaller. Their boiling spit is just the perfect temperature for a mull. Their scalding saliva deals CQ flame damage.
Warmth, wonder, and moisture are familiar to a Steep, and sometimes the spirits they call linger on to comfort others. Mark to neutralize the effects of bad air, spores, or cold.
Tangible things steep and disperse their essence through the Physical Realm. Mark to know the past of an object.
Choose a bloodline. When healing a member of that bloodline, treat conflict results as triumphs.
Works just as well on foes as it does patients. Deals CQ serrated damage.
You can use a task to work on healing up to three traits, injuries or companions at a time.
Mark to acquire one of three resources, Hungry Leeches, Soporific Draught or Medicinal Herbs.
Increase impact when healing others in a safe environment.
When a nearby ally takes damage, hijack focus to immediately heal one point of that damage (once per scene).
An odd-smelling unguent for spreading on a vessel's doorways, dispensed liberally as a matter of course. Increase your ship's Seals rating by one when you're aboard.
You receive a whisper whenever a crewmate fully heals from an injury.
Hard to get hold of, but terrifyingly potent. Burn to give you or a crewmate resistance to all damage for the duration of a scene or increased impact on all attacks for the duration of a scene.
You’re immune to disease, and resist the effects of bad air and airborne spores.
Mark to identify one of a target’s weak points or weaknesses
Mark to allow a crew-mate to benefit from a fully marked trait or companion for the duration of a scene.
You scrub, clean and de-spore surfaces with regularity. Whenever you or one of your crew takes an injury, reduce the injury track by one box.
Mark mire to drain the falsehood out of a statement, hearing the truth behind it. You gain a whisper based on the excised lies
Sacrifice a whisper to discern the properties of a mysterious illness or injury.
Mark to instantly switch places with a willing crewmate within sight, or burn to switch with them and hijack focus at the same time.
Mark to deal volt damage to all nearby foes, or burn to increase it to massive volt damage.
Mark to kickstart a machine, charge a depleted power source or temporarily increase the effectiveness of an engine
A guitar-like instrument carved from the bones of an ironjaw ray. Produces a harsh, buzzing tone when played that seems to awaken the spirit of rebellion in some.
You can direct bursts of voltaic energy through your palms or fingers, dealing LR volt damage.
Deal volt damage to any creature that attacks you with their own body in close quarters (such as with tail or bite attacks).
Use a task and mark to quiet or banish a storm, or use a task and burn to summon one.
You’re resistant to three damage types, chosen from the following list: Frost, Flame, Salt, Blast, Volt.
Winds around limbs and under clothes, always moving. Mark to identify the nearest source of potent electricity, no matter the distance.
A small, playful feline made of roiling stormclouds. Gives your entire crew resistance to volt damage.
Mark to float for a brief time, electricity crackling around you as you do so.
You can sense nearby electrical fields, such as those produced by living organisms
Increase impact when dealing volt or blast damage during an electrical storm or heavy rainfall.
You can raise your voice to an ear-splitting shout, dealing CQ blast damage and being easily heard over long distances.
A simple light source that runs off of your own internal charge. Mark to deplete a nearby source of electricity, absorbing it into the lantern for a brighter glow
You can act as an additional (or main) engine for your ship, powering its bite with your mere presence. Increase your ship's Speed rating by one when you're aboard.

data.tooltip:
An edge of elegance, precision & agility
You’re at your best when you’re free to move, using superior mobility and unexpected speed to run rings around a problem. Grace gives you the edge when dodging and balancing, performing acrobatic feats and attacking with lighter weapons.

An edge of sense, intuition & reaction
You’re at your best when going with the flow, acting without a plan and trusting either your gut or your body’s natural senses. Instinct is often used to react to unexpected events and hazards, learn more about the world around you and connect with the weirder elements of the waves.

An edge of force, determination & willpower
You’re at your best when relying on direct action, using sheer grit to carry you through. Iron is often used for weathering incoming damage, keeping your cool in tense situations, imposing your will on others and attacking with heavier weapons.

An edge of logic, wit & planning
You’re at your best when you can bring intelligence and preparation to bear, relying on the knowledge that your mind (or tongue) are sharper than any blade. Sharps is often used to solve problems, untangle complexities, design or create new objects and outmanoeuvre others in verbal conflicts.

An edge of savagery, passion & destruction
You’re at your best when letting loose, exposing the wilder parts of your nature and damning the consequences. Teeth is often used to inflict fear on others, to destroy objects and relationships, to disregard convention and to make brutal, uncompromising attacks.

An edge of exploration, learning & lore
You’re at your best when relying on your knowledge of the waves, the quirks and secrets of the wildsea that others might write off as mere folktales. Tides is often used for unearthing secrets and mysteries, spinning engaging tales, charting new courses and steering ships.

An edge of shadows, ciphers & secrecy
You’re at your best when your influence is near-impossible to detect, managing situations from behind the scenes. Veils is often used to go undetected or cover your tracks, to backstab and betray and to manipulate others in both social and combat situations.

A clipped and precise language used by experienced traders, adapted from the punch-cards of ancient ordinators. Knowledge of brasstongue is likely to garner respect among merchants and grifters. 
Lore might include cargo routes and tales of great sales or negotiation tactics.

data.tooltip:
A chemical language of subtle twitches and soft clicks used by the gau. Though the structure and grammar are surprisingly easy to learn, pheromonal bursts are required to communicate the most complex concepts. 
Lore might include detailed knowledge of caves, tunnels and the progression of rot.

data.tooltip:
Exceedingly difficult to master, Highvin is a primarily written language often found on old pre-verdant ruins. Usually understood by scholars, antiquarians and treasure-hunters.
Lore might include details of the pre-verdant times, though always fragmentary.

data.tooltip:
The hissing, chittering voice of the tzelicrae hive-minds. Many of the sounds are impossible for a single mouth to form, so most outsiders that learn knock speak a simplified form relying partly on gesture. 
Lore might include a deeper understanding of insects and arachnid minds and habits.

data.tooltip:
All characters start with a free fluency in Low Sour.
A mongrel language that has developed in the years since the shattered post-verdancy cultures started making contact with each other.
Low Sour is the closest thing to a ‘common tongue’ on the waves, and doesn't come with any particular lore or cultural knowledge besides what every wildsailor would know about the world they live in.

The lilting tongue of poets and songwriters across the wild waves, well-suited to performances and long-form poetry. 
Lore might include ancient pre-verdant songs and a deeper understanding of whispers.

◊ Discovering the secrets of the surrounding waves
